dynamic_adjustments_for_task_failures_an.condition: The knife or cutting tool is not aligned with the object properly.

adjustment_strategies.description: The agent adjusts the position of the tool to realign with the object and ensure an accurate cut.
Use visual feedback to adjust the tool’s alignment before continuing the cutting process.

dynamic_adjustments_for_task_failures_an.condition: The object is too tough or the agent applies too much force while cutting.

adjustment_strategies.description: The agent slows down the cutting motion to apply more controlled force and prevent damage to the object or tool.
If resistance is high, the agent uses a more suitable tool, such as a serrated knife for tougher items.

dynamic_adjustments_for_task_failures_an.condition: The agent’s cut is uneven or not aligned as planned.

adjustment_strategies.description: The agent stops the cutting process, reassesses the angle of the tool, and adjusts to correct the path.
The agent uses a guide (e.g., ruler or cutting guide) to ensure more accurate and even cuts.

dynamic_adjustments_for_task_failures_an.condition: The object being cut slips or is dropped during the cutting process.

adjustment_strategies.description: The agent places the object on a non-slip surface or uses a hand to hold it steady before resuming cutting.
The agent adjusts their hand position or the grip on the tool to ensure better control during the cut.

dynamic_adjustments_for_task_failures_an.condition: The agent injures themselves or experiences discomfort during the cutting process.

adjustment_strategies.description: The agent stops, applies first aid if necessary, and reassesses their approach before continuing.
The agent uses gloves or other protective equipment to reduce the risk of injury during subsequent attempts.
